Oneness.quote: There is no god but God - La ilaha illa Allah. (Islamic Shahada)

Unity.quote: I and the Father are one. (John 10:30)

Self-Definition.quote: Before Abraham was born, I am. (John 8:58)

Absolute Identity.quote: Aham Brahmasmi - I am Brahman. (Brhadaranyaka Upanishad 1.4.10)

Divine Uniqueness.quote: There is none like You among the gods, O Lord. (Psalm 86:8)

Essential Nature.quote: The Tao that is eternal has no name. (Tao Te Ching 32)

Supreme Identity.quote: Krishna is the Supreme Personality of Godhead. (Bhagavad Gita 7:7)

Divine Self.quote: The Self alone exists, one without a second. (Chandogya Upanishad 6.2.1)

Transcendent Being.quote: Beyond being and non-being, I AM. (Bhagavad Gita 13:12)

Ultimate Reality.quote: The Real is one without a second. (Chandogya Upanishad 6.2.1)

Divine Essence.quote: God is the Light of the heavens and the earth. (Quran 24:35)

Eternal Identity.quote: I am the same yesterday, today, and forever. (Hebrews 13:8)

Sacred Name.quote: Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts. (Isaiah 6:3)

Divine Presence.quote: I am with you always, even to the end of the age. (Matthew 28:20)

Absolute Being.quote: That which exists is One; sages call it by various names. (Rig Veda 1.164.46)

Supreme Self.quote: Atman is Brahman - The individual self is identical with the universal Self. (Mandukya Upanishad)

Divine Recognition.quote: Those who know Me in truth enter into Me. (Bhagavad Gita 4:9)

Cosmic Identity.quote: The universe is but a partial manifestation of My divine glory. (Bhagavad Gita 10:42)

Pure Consciousness.quote: God is pure consciousness, eternal truth and absolute being. (Yoga Sutras 1:23)

Yahweh.quote: I AM WHO I AM (YHWH). This is my name forever. (Exodus 3:14-15)

Allah.quote: Say: He is Allah, the One and Only (Al-Ahad). (Quran 112:1)

Brahman.quote: Brahman is Truth, Knowledge, Infinity. (Taittiriya Upanishad 2.1.1)

Tao.quote: The Tao that can be named is not the eternal Tao. (Tao Te Ching 1)

Ein Sof.quote: The Infinite One (Ein Sof), beyond all description and limitation. (Zohar)

Krishna.quote: I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds. (Bhagavad Gita 10:8)

Trinity.quote: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit. (Matthew 28:19)

Shiva.quote: I am the Supreme Brahman, I am the Lord (Shiva). (Shiva Purana)

Ahura Mazda.quote: Wise Lord (Ahura Mazda), creator of all good things. (Avesta)

Great Spirit.quote: The Great Spirit (Wakan Tanka) is in all things. (Lakota Teaching)

Elohim.quote: In the beginning, Elohim created the heavens and the earth. (Genesis 1:1)

Al-Haqq.quote: Allah is the Truth (Al-Haqq), and that which they call upon besides Him is falsehood. (Quran 22:62)

Sat-Chit-Ananda.quote: The nature of the Divine is Being-Consciousness-Bliss (Sat-Chit-Ananda). (Vedanta)

Adonai.quote: The Lord (Adonai) is our God, the Lord is One. (Deuteronomy 6:4)

Shakti.quote: The Divine Mother (Shakti) is the power of the Supreme. (Devi Mahatmya)

Logos.quote: In the beginning was the Word (Logos), and the Word was with God. (John 1:1)

Dharmakaya.quote: The ultimate nature of reality (Dharmakaya) is empty yet luminous. (Mahayana Buddhism)

Parabrahman.quote: Beyond Brahman is Parabrahman, the Absolute Supreme. (Upanishads)

Al-Nur.quote: Allah is the Light (Al-Nur) of the heavens and the earth. (Quran 24:35)

Ain.quote: The Nothing (Ain) that contains all possibilities. (Kabbalah)

Purushottama.quote: I am the Supreme Person (Purushottama), beyond both the perishable and the imperishable. (Bhagavad Gita 15:18)

Odin.quote: All-Father Odin, wielder of Gungnir. (Norse Eddas)

Amaterasu.quote: The Sun Goddess from whom all light flows. (Kojiki)

Vishnu.quote: I am the sustainer of all worlds. (Bhagavad Gita)

Ra.quote: Ra, the sun god, creator of all things. (Egyptian Book of the Dead)

Quetzalcoatl.quote: The Feathered Serpent, wind and wisdom. (Aztec Codices)

Shangdi.quote: The Supreme Deity above, ruler of heaven. (Chinese Classics)

Tengri.quote: The Eternal Blue Sky, supreme god. (Turkic-Mongol Tradition)

Ialdabaoth.quote: The blind god who claimed to be the only god. (Gnostic Texts)

Baal.quote: Lord of the heavens and earth. (Canaanite Texts)

Marduk.quote: King of the gods, creator of the cosmos. (Enuma Elish)

Ahura Mazda.quote: Wise Lord, creator of all good things. (Avesta)

Horus.quote: The far-seeing one, lord of the sky. (Egyptian Mythology)

Jupiter.quote: Supreme father of gods and men. (Roman Mythology)

Indra.quote: King of the gods, wielder of the thunderbolt. (Vedas)

El.quote: The father of years, creator of creatures. (Ugaritic Texts)

Manitou.quote: The Great Spirit that moves in all things. (Algonquian)

Anu.quote: Father of the gods, lord of the constellations. (Sumerian Texts)

Ptah.quote: The opener, creator who spoke all into being. (Memphis Theology)

Osiris.quote: Lord of eternity, ruler of everlastingness. (Egyptian Book of the Dead)

Tezcatlipoca.quote: Smoking Mirror, lord of the night sky. (Aztec Religion)

Enlil.quote: Lord of the air, determiner of destinies. (Sumerian Hymns)

Shango.quote: King of thunder and lightning. (Yoruba Religion)

Xiwangmu.quote: Queen Mother of the West, keeper of immortality. (Chinese Mythology)

Tiamat.quote: Primordial goddess of the salt sea. (Babylonian Creation Myth)

Wotan.quote: All-father, wanderer, seeker of wisdom. (Germanic Mythology)

Ukko.quote: Supreme god of the sky, weather and harvest. (Finnish Mythology)

Viracocha.quote: Creator god of the Incas, maker of all things. (Incan Religion)

Deus.quote: The one God, source of all being. (Latin Christianity)

Theos.quote: The Divine, source of all that exists. (Greek Philosophy)
